intro: Aurinia edentula, commonly known as the toothless aurinia, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, also known as the mustard family, and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant thrives in harsh, cold environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its ability to survive in extreme conditions makes it an important component of alpine and tundra ecosystems. Aurinia edentula plays a role in soil stabilization and provides food for various herbivorous insects and small mammals.
